main event: Three silver-blue circular objects, tapering to a tail like a comet, were observed flying at an estimated altitude of 1000 feet in a north-west to south-east direction over Tallman, New York at 21:31 EDT on 28 July 1949.
interesting points: The objects were noticed at five-minute intervals, suggesting a possible pattern or organized movement.
A searchlight was observed playing in the sky, seemingly attempting to follow the objects, indicating official interest in tracking the unidentified aerial phenomena.
The report was made by a civilian, Mr. A.F. Miller, and there were no photographs provided as evidence.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were described as high overcast with no visibility restrictions.
The observation was made from the ground with no apparent sound, odor, trail, luminosity, projections, maneuvers, or effect on clouds reported.
